bio:treatment.discussion: In the flora area, Didymodon anserinocapitatus is known only from Colorado and New Mexico (R. H. Zander and W. A. Weber 1997). The arctic species D. johansenii is similar in the swollen, deciduous apex, but differs mainly by its distal laminal cells 13–15 µm wide, and guide cells in only a single layer. Didymodon rigidulus var. icmadophilus, a widespread montane taxon, is similar in appearance but its leaf apices are never swollen though sometimes fragile. The American material differs from the Asian type (China: Tibet, Nan Xian, Zang Mu 1704, isotype–NY) in being less robust, the leaves reaching only 1.8 mm, and the proximal cells quadrate to short-rectangular (leaves to 2 mm and proximal cells to 4:1 in the Asian specimen).
